title: Case Info Draft
description: A first version on the validation rules after a case setup, displaying all the available options for regions, boundaries and general simulation settings. This version is NOT final.

regions.description: Array with all the regions, each of which has a uploaded STL/step file.

interfaces.description: Array of interfaces defined between two regions

r1.$comment: Id of one of the defined regions, validation should check that this region exists

r2.$comment: Id of one of the defined regions, validation should check that this region exists

fluid.description: A region defined as a fluid

properties.description: A material with the properties for fluiddefinition

turbulence.description: Turbulence model. Please refer to the documentation if you are not sure which one to select. The kOmegaSST model is suggested to take as a starting point.

boundaries.description: Array with all the boundaries, each of which has a uploaded STL file.

subregions.description: Array with subregions, each of which has a uploaded STL file.

solid.description: A region defined as a solid

properties.description: A material with the properties for solid definition

boundaries.description: Array with all the boundaries, each of which has a uploaded STL file.

subregions.description: Array with subregions, each of which has a uploaded STL file.

general.description: A subregion defined as a part in a region

properties.description: A material with the properties for design definition

kappaX.description: Anisotropic thermal conductivity [W/(mâK)] along X-axis.

kappaY.description: Anisotropic thermal conductivity [W/(mâK)] along Y-axis.

kappaZ.description: Anisotropic thermal conductivity [W/(mâK)] along Z-axis.

Rk.description: Thermal conductivy of thermal resistance layer [W/(mâK)]

performanceCurve.description: A list of X and Y coÃ¶rdinates to form a fan/pump performance curve

weight.description: The weight of the target function. Change this value if you have multiple targets and you want to change the importance of this target. A value of 1 means that the target is the most important. A value of 0 means that the target is not important. []

electricWirePowerMinimization.description: Apply heating by an electric wire in the design region, but minimize the heating power

maximumElectricWirePower.description: Maximum electric power through an electric wire

inputoptions.description: Three input options possible: (1) constant value, (2) polynomial values: array of max 8 elements, (3) tabulated values: A list of X and Y coÃ¶rdinates to form a curve. X-values is the temperature [K], Y-values is the parameter value

oneOf.description: Polynomial input: Y = a + b.X + c.X^2 + d.X^3 + e.X^4 + f.X^5 + g.X^6 + h.X^7. Input is array with [a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h]
Tabulated input:  A list of X and Y coÃ¶rdinates to form a curve. X-values is the temperature [K], Y-values is the parameter value
